entry.title: Interlude on I-10
entry.summary:
Author: Bookworm0303

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 61,717Chapters: 11/15Kudos: 1,505

Summary: Without waiting for a reaction or reply, the man bore down on the gas and peeled down the highway, leaving Buck stranded in the middle of nowhere somewhere along Interstate 10. And as Buck watched the red brake lights of his Jeep disappear into the distance, clutching his prescription of blood thinners tightly to his chest... there was really only one thing left to do. Tilting his head back until he was staring at the stars, he took a deep breath and screamed into the night: “Fuck!” And much like every other one of his recent cries for help, it had gone unanswered. --- Buck gets carjacked, held at gunpoint, and stranded in Arizona the day before his first shift post-lawsuit. And that's only the beginning of his troubles.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 278,797Chapters: 45/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: just a little bit of your heart (is all I'm asking for)
entry.summary:
Author: dbolterstar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 320,416Chapters: 33/55Kudos: 341

Summary: “Does this change a thing between us?” Buck asks, his voice low, his hands still framing Eddie’s face. He can feel the unsteady breaths leaving Eddie’s lips, warm against his own. Eddie looks wrecked. His cheeks are flushed, lips red and kiss-swollen, his glassy eyes locked on Buck’s mouth like it’s the only thing he can see. He looks as hungry as Buck feels. Buck feels Eddie’s fingers trace along his arms, squeezing just enough to leave his skin tingling. “I don’t know.” It’s not a yes—Buck’s not even sure he wants to hear a yes. But it’s so much better than the rejection Eddie threw at him before. “Alright,” Buck exhales, nodding like it’s nothing, even though it feels massive. Then he surges forward, catching Eddie’s mouth in his again. The soft, desperate sound Eddie lets out—like relief and need tangled together—hits Buck like a punch to the chest. or; Eddie’s shame torments him. Buck would rather have a piece of Eddie than nothing at all. Miscommunication is their biggest enemy. Infidelity turns into their savior… or ends up being the thing that destroys them?

entry.title: Just one more breath
entry.summary:
Author: CarpeDiem911

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 49,541Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 217

Summary: The hysterical laughter stole every coherent thought from Buck and crawled into his bones; his heart thudded and he stared at the doll in disbelief. Then, as suddenly as it had started, the laughter stopped; leaving an eerie silence. Buck stood frozen, his thoughts like thick mud, staring at that stupid doll. He completely missed the huge hole in the wall above the tub. He missed the shadow standing there, watching him from behind the hole with cold eyes and a malicious smile.

entry.title: To Talk to the Dead
entry.summary:
Author: not-blonde-yet (stillredhead_just_tired)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,028Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 13

Summary: There is something wrong with Buck. He’s been missing for three weeks, and when he finally reappears, he isn’t the brother Maddie remembers. He doesn’t remember his name, he speaks with a British accent, and he looks at his family with cold eyes. While the 118 tries to handle a version of Buck who is cruel, dangerous, and utterly unfamiliar, Athena Grant investigates a series of disappearances and deaths centered around a mysterious bar. But when she runs into two brothers in flannel who specialize in the impossible, they realize that saving Buck might require more than just medical intervention.

entry.title: If I Never Told You (I Love You)
entry.summary:
Author: astroglowy13

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,692Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 6

Summary: His lips are softer than Eddie would have thought. He can feel the scruff of his face, the hair poking back out after having not been shaved in almost 24hours. He brings his hand up to cradle his cheek and runs his thumb over it, resting his other hand on Buck’s hip. He pushes slightly deeper into the kiss, wanting to bury himself in Buck. Convince himself that the man is ok. And it feels good. Better than any kiss Eddie has ever had. Better than any kiss has any right to feel. It feels right. And then Eddie realizes what he’s doing. And Eddie panics. He pulls away so fast, Buck almost seeming to follow him, as if searching for the connection again. Which can’t be right. Eddie just kissed Buck. In front of everyone. And he liked it. Fuck. ......   Or; Buck hasn't been doing well since Bobby died. It's all he can think about... except for when he is with Eddie. Eddie's anxiety has only gotten worse. Especially when it comes to Buck. He wants, maybe even needs, to be around him. And when a fire leads to an accidental first kiss which leads too... Buck and Eddie will realize its better to speak then to die.

entry.title: Tell Me Why Can't This Be Love?
entry.summary:
Author: Frawg_Spawn

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,747Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 456

Summary: "It's fine, Jee," Eddie says. "Buck doesn't have to kiss me." "Yes he does." Jee crosses her arms and looks sternly at Buck. "Daddy and Mommy kiss every time when they go away from each other." "Yeah, okay." Buck sucks in a breath and steps towards Eddie. He ducks his head down and presses the most fleeting kiss to Eddie's cheek. "Not like that," Jee scolds. "What? Why not?" Buck squawks. "Because," she sighs and gives him a long, disapproving look. "Mommy and Daddy always kiss on the lips." ~ or, buddie babysit Jee while being pretend boyfriends

entry.title: Five Times Christopher Realized His Dads Suck at Being Divorced (and the One Time They Finally Admitted It
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,068Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 54

Summary: Christopher Diaz was five years old, and five-year-olds, as far as he could tell, were supposed to know things. His teacher said he was very smart. Abuela said “Ay, qué niño tan inteligente,” his Buck said he had a brain like a superhero…always noticing things, always remembering things. So when his dads sat him down on the couch one warm Sunday afternoon and told him they were getting divorced, he tried very, very hard to understand. He really did. But the problem was that nothing looked different. Or, Chris Diaz grows up with divorced parents who really, truly suck at actually being divorced. By the time he’s a sophomore in college, he’s just waiting for them to admit what he’s known since he was five: they were always going to find their way back to each other.

entry.title: 118 Valley
entry.summary:
Author: OptionUnavailable

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,825Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 14

Summary: As a kid, Buck loved to spend the summers on his grandpa's farm in Pelican Town. His parents would send him there so they didn't have to deal with him, but Buck didn't mind, neither did Grandpa. He would spend the mornings helping Grandpa with chores and afternoons playing with the neighborhood kids. Fresh air, no-judgement town, and his grandpa paid more attention to him than his parents! This was the life!But what would happen if Buck's parents thought that he was getting too comfortable there? That Grandpa was putting too many thoughts in his head about how he can be "anything"? What would happen if Buck wasn't allowed to return to his friends and his second life inside the valley?

entry.title: The Abby Effect
entry.summary:
Author: jamespctters

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,527Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 574

Summary: “This isn’t my life!” Buck exclaims. “This is not how it’s supposed to be. Abby is supposed to be gone. She’s supposed to have left. As in, left Los Angeles, not left me to marry Bobby. Bobby’s supposed to marry Athena.” “Cap and Athena? But she’s—” “Married. Yeah,” Buck huffs. “Like I said, that doesn’t work out.” “Because Real Michael is gay?” Eddie asks skeptically. “Real Michael is gay,” Buck confirms.OR: After his break up with Tommy, Buck falls asleep on Eddie’s couch and wakes up in a world where Bobby is married to Abby, Hen and Karen are divorced, Athena and Michael are faking a happy marriage, Chim has a daughter that is not Buck's niece, and—just to really, personally fuck with him—Eddie and Maddie are engaged to be married.
